tweets.text: @Plasmadreamer @CertusCC @UnderwaterMedia @mark__mcg @AnglingTrust @sascampaigns @HugoSAS @theriverstrust @amyslack84 @mattymarlow @EnvAgency Still got plenty of money for the shareholders.

@CertusCC @UnderwaterMedia @mark__mcg @AnglingTrust @sascampaigns @HugoSAS @theriverstrust @amyslack84 @mattymarlow @EnvAgency Water companies run their businesses to meet legislative requirements. EA polices legislation, government sets legislation. Most companies only have a very limited budget for ‚Äòdiscretionary spend‚Äô as their spending plans have to be approved by OFWAT.

Don't flush kitchen roll down the loo - it doesn't dissolve the same way as toilet paper.

Flushing it down the loo damages your pipes and can cause flooding.

To protect our environment, always put kitchen roll in the bin.

#Unblocktober https://t.co/ViFB8LlgM4

@suesustainable @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @DefraGovUK @ZacGoldsmith @BenGoldsmith Exactly the point I made to @JamesBevanEA on a webinar last week. Loads of great positive stuff being done on the ground by @EnvAgency staff - especially led by fisheries/biodiversity/geomorphology teams but very little publicised since @Defra took over the comms responsibility.

Cooking the #SundayRoast today? 

Follow our simple steps to dispose of cooking oil or fat & help protect your pipes & the #environment 

‚úÖPour leftover cooking fats into a heat proof container        
‚úÖLeave to cool
‚úÖScrape into the food waste or bin

urls.description: Slow The Flow is a charity working to advance the education of the public in Natural Flood Management, Sustainable Drainage Systems and other renewable methods of managing the environment.

tweets.text: @kfbanhart @qwag @mikelondonse @LadyPam56529437 @mentalmapping @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency @ThameswaterRM @EnviroLewisham There was a ditch draining the Woodyates area that flowed down to Lee Green. It was piped. I think in the ?60s they used a mole to turn it west up Southbrook then along Wantage and up Taunton. There is still occasional basement flooding in the shops and there has been ...

@qwag @mikelondonse @LadyPam56529437 @mentalmapping @EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency @ThameswaterRM @EnviroLewisham If you lean over the wall at the corner of Taunton Road and Manor Lane, looking a little upstream you will see a large square outlet in the wall to your right. I believe this is where the stuff comes from. Otherwise it's someone's back garden!

Are beaver dams a barrier to migrating fish? Mark Elliott @elyethefish explains how sea trout can migrate over beaver dams during autumn #floods   @extetergeography @DrAVowles @westcountryRT @envAgency @BenGoldsmith @ben_a_goldfarb @theriverstrust @gwct https://t.co/6dWZTSaIop

@DevonWildlife @elyethefish @DrAVowles @WestcountryRT @EnvAgency @BenGoldsmith @ben_a_goldfarb @theriverstrust @GWCT On Tuesday we visited the River Otter catchment with new PhD researcher Kye Davies @wildearthnotes who's exploring the relationship between beavers and aquatic ecology. During observations sea trout were filmed successfully passing a dam in high water flows (Film 
@austerroger) https://t.co/r9aRRZgdvA

tweets.text: Great to see multi-species brush being used to help fish migration. Interesting discussion alongside it over the use of  plastics in long-term situations compared to single use plastics when you can't remove barriers #Water4Growth @DCFishEA  @WestcountryRT @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/1xozoSnjC3

First (for me) gravel addition to improve spawning #habitat. @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE #fishery improvement fund working with keen Nidderdale AC & hardcore @YorkDalesRT vols. Woody deflectors to focus flows & aid retention of gravel.
400m of Dauber Gill, Nidd trib enhanced. https://t.co/xpmJW77oeX

Miles of spawning habitat opened up to #fish on the R Camel thanks to improvements made to #Camelford weir.  100% recycled #plastic baffles help fish cross the weir at times of low flow.   @NESouthWest  @WestcountryRT @DCFishEA #Water4Growth Before and after pix https://t.co/mpluV1y4sy

@ExeterGeography @DevonWildlife @elyethefish @DrAVowles @WestcountryRT @EnvAgency @BenGoldsmith @ben_a_goldfarb @theriverstrust @GWCT @AusterRoger From leaps to tweets and three's a treat! A third clip of these majestic migrating sea #trout jumping over a #beaver dam on the River Otter (no sound)

@AusterRoger @hughagraham https://t.co/ldBwv9MHEy

Bringing your reusable bag to markets can help reduce plastic pollution. With up to 5 trillion single-use plastic bags used every year, polluting the ocean & the environment, a simple act can make all the difference!

#ActNow ‚Ä¢ https://t.co/ARY2J9WDPW https://t.co/jmD8jzenkj

urls.title: Act Now | United Nations
urls.description: ActNow is the United Nations‚Äô global call to individual action on climate change. The campaign is a critical part of the UN‚Äôs coordinated effort to raise awareness, ambition, and action for climate change and accelerate implementation of the Paris Agreement.
